newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid stocks surge in heavy trade, but off highs.
newsitem.headline: Madrid stocks surge in heavy trade, but off highs.

text.p: Madrid stocks closed on Wednesday with strong gains, but off highs, as investors flocked to the market, showing strong interest in all sectors, dealers said.
The general index rose 3.78 points, 0.79 percent, to 482.00 and the Ibex-35 gained 44.45 points, 0.81 percent, to 5,527.24.
"The market has a very solid base, there's interest in taking positions and if also following New York, the investor climate is very good," one dealer said.

Total trading volume reached almost 79 billion pesetas with dealers saying there could be even further strong buying interest if Spanish March inflation data forecast for 0.24 percent is confirmed on Friday.
Repsol, which moved a volume of 2.2 million shares, gained 140 pesetas to a high of 6,150 on the third day of a subscription period ahead of a share offer for the state's remaining 10 percent stake.
Telefonica rose 35 pesetas to 3,435 and Endesa gained 70 pesetas to 9,360, while Sevillana fell 10 to 1,290.
Among big banks, BBV rose 130 pesetas to 8,750, Santander dropped 20 to 9,779 and Argentaria gained 100 to 6,220.
